result.execSummary:
The defendant Tammy M Pulver was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Tammy M Pulver is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Tammy M Pulver was found guilty of Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).
  • Tammy M Pulver was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Transfer of probation authorized to Columbia Co.
5/12/14: Crt orders JOC be amended to reflect 5 days of jail credit should her probation ever be revoked (prev 0).

miscConds.notes: $250 DNA surcharge remitted. Court costs pd by bail.
Maintain full-time employment/education or combination of or be seeking same, and treatment.

Random UA & BA testing at discretion of agent.  Pay supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Defendant advised of requirement to provide DNA sample.  Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.
Defendant shall not use/possess drug paraphernalia and/or controlled substances without a valid prescription.
All other conditions are the same as count 1.
